{{short description|2018 American Christian film}} {{Missing information|Plot|date=December 2018}}{{Infobox film | name = Indivisible | image = IndivisibleFilm.jpeg | alt = | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = David G. Evans | producer = {{ubl|Darren Moorman|Justin Tolley}} | screenplay = {{ubl|[[Cheryl McKay]]|David G. Evans|Peter White}} | starring = {{ubl|[[Sarah Drew]]|[[Justin Bruening]]|Eddie Kaulukukui|[[Jason George]]|[[Madeline Carroll]]|Tanner Stine|[[Michael O'Neal]]| [[Tia Mowry]]|[[Eric Close]]}} | music = Paul Millis | cinematography = Bob Scott | editing = Jeff Canavan | studio = {{ubl|[[Pure Flix]]|[[Provident Films]]|The WTA Group}} | distributor = Pure Flix | released = {{film date|2018|10|26}} | runtime = 119 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = $2.7 million<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.commercialappeal.com/story/entertainment/2018/05/11/memphis-made-indivisible-new-faith-film-screen-visions-military/576964002/|title=Screen Visions: Memphis-made 'Indivisible' tells true story of marital and military combat|website=Commercial Appeal |date=May 11, 2018 |first=John |last=Beifuss |accessdate=October 27, 2018}}</ref> | gross = $3.6 million<ref>{{cite web|url=https://m.the-numbers.com/movie/Indivisible-(2018)#tab=summary|title=Indivisible (2018) — Financial Information|website=[[The Numbers (website)|The Numbers]]|accessdate=December 18, 2018}}</ref> }} '''''Indivisible''''' is a 2018 American [[Christian film industry|Christian]] [[Drama (film and television)|drama film]] directed by David G. Evans. Starring [[Sarah Drew]], [[Justin Bruening]], [[Tia Mowry]], and [[Eric Close]], the film is based on the true story of Darren Turner. It follows an Army [[chaplain]] as he struggles to balance his faith and the [[Iraq War]]. It was released in the United States on October 26, 2018 by [[Pure Flix]] and received positive to mixed reviews from critics.
==Cast== * [[Justin Bruening]] as Darren Turner, an Army Chaplain * [[Sarah Drew]] as Heather Turner, Darren's wife * Eddie Kaulukukui as Sgt. Carter * [[Eric Close]] as Ltc. Jacobsen * [[Tia Mowry]] as Tonya Lewis, Michael's wife * [[Jason Winston George]] as Michael Lewis * [[Madeline Carroll]] as Amanda Bradley * [[Michael O'Neill (actor)|Michael O'Neill]] as Chaplain Rogers * Skye P. Marshall as Sgt. Shonda Peterson * Tanner Stine as Lance Bradley
==Production== The film shot over the course of 32 days in [[Memphis, Tennessee]], with the Iraq scenes being filmed near [[Santa Clarita, California|Santa Clarita]], California, ending in June 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sonomachristianhome.com/2017/06/upcoming-patriotic-family-film-indivisible-wraps-production/|title=Upcoming Patriotic Family Film 'Indivisible' Wraps Production |website=Sonoma Christian|date=June 23, 2018|accessdate=October 24, 2018}}</ref>
==Release== ''Indivisible'' premiered on October 5, 2018 at the [[Orpheum Theatre (Memphis)|Orpheum Theatre]] in Memphis, and was theatrically released in the United States on October 26, 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.commercialappeal.com/story/news/2018/10/03/indivisible-movie-memphis-premiere-orpheum/1486863002/|title=Indivisible': Memphis-made Christian film has red-carpet world premiere at the Orpheum|website=Commercial Appeal|date=October 5, 2018|accessdate=October 24, 2018}}</ref>
===Box office=== In the United States and Canada, ''Indivisible'' was released alongside ''[[Hunter Killer (film)|Hunter Killer]]'' and ''[[Johnny English Strikes Again]]'', and was projected to gross around $3 million from 830 theaters in its opening weekend.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/box-office/halloween-box-office-second-weekend-jamie-lee-curtis-1202990149/|title=‘Halloween’ to Make Another Killing at the Box Office|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=Rebecca|last=Rubin|date=October 24, 2018|accessdate=October 24, 2018}}</ref> It ended up debuting to $1.5 million,<ref name=BOM>{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=indivisible.htm|title=Indivisible (2018)|website=[[Box Office Mojo]]||accessdate=December 18, 2018}}</ref> finishing 13th at the box office.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2018&wknd=43&p=.htm|title=October 26-28, 2018 Weekend|publisher=Box Office Mojo|accessdate=October 29, 2018}}</ref><ref name="opening">{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2018/10/halloween-screaming-a-33m-second-weekend-will-slash-100m-mark-tonight-1202490458/|title=‘Halloween’ Screams $32M Second Weekend As October B.O. Moves Toward Record|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|date=October 28, 2018 |first=Anthony |last= D'Alessandro|accessdate=October 28, 2018}}</ref>
===Critical response=== On [[review aggregator]] [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film holds an approval rating of 72% based on 18 reviews, with an average rating of 6.3/10.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/indivisible_2018/|title=Indivisible (2018)|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|accessdate=November 17, 2018}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], the film has a weighted average score of 53 out of 100, based on 6 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/movie/indivisible-2018 |title=Indivisible (2018) Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=October 28, 2018}}</ref> Audiences polled by [[CinemaScore]] gave the film an average grade of "A" on an A+ to F scale, while [[PostTrak]] reported filmgoers gave it an 82% positive score.<ref name="opening"/>
